title: Can the Internet (meaning 'www') be saved? - Quora

response.answer_text: Google indexes the Internet as much as it can, but it is more prone to showing recent copies of things. Typing in cache: and the URL will often show the last saved copy of a website. However, it is Digital Library of Free & Borrowable Books, Movies, Music & Wayback Machine that is responsible for trying to save copies — even if just blurbs — of the Internet. There are websites like Wikipedia that make their entire library available for download — and actually encourage anyone to come download a copy and host it somewhere for backup purposes.
